description.narrative: As the response in Somalia transitions from immediate emergency response, the situation remains fragile and interventions are required to treat the acutely malnourished, address underlying causes of malnutrition and to lay the foundation for sustainable monitoring and response. Our approach is aligned with the Basic Nutrition Services Package for Somalia and with the Somali Nutrition Strategy2011-2013. The design of this programme directly addresses outcomes 1, 2, 3, and 6 in the nutrition strategy7, and takes an approach consistent with the objectives of the Basic Nutrition Services Package. The proposed programme will be implemented by the Somalia Nutrition Consortium, a consortium comprised of four leading nutrition organizations: ACF, OXFAM, ConcernWorldwide and Save the Children.Direct beneficiaries: 63,931 children treated for SAM (output 1), 642, 841 Pregnant and Lactating Mothers benefit from improvedknowledge and practices in relation to IYCF, health and hygiene (output 2). Location: Hiran.Donor DFID

participating-org.narrative: The Humanitarian Agency for Relief and Development Organisation (HARDO) is a Somali local NGO based in the Hiran region, working inSomalia with CARE International, USAID and some UN agencies like FAO and WFP. HARDO was founded in 1993 as a community committee bytwenty university graduates from the agronomy and engineering sectors. Currently HARDO seeks to address the urgent needs of the people, mainly in the Hiran region in Southern Central Somalia. HARDO has shown consistency in serving as an early warning focal point for CARE regarding emergency food distribution. HARDO has also followed more than 30 workshops provided by CARE International, especially in the area of food security and SPHERE standards. HARDO has a board of directories with seven members, who lead different programs, which HARDO implements simultaneously at various locations and regions. HARDO has qualified and specialised staff (such as doctors, accountants, lawyers and agronomists) who implement and supervise activities to make sure that activities follow HARDO's guidelines and policy, and contribute to achieving the organisation's goals. HARDO's vision is to see all Somali people live in peace, justice, equity, prosperity and wellbeing. Its mission is to eradicate poverty amongthe Somali people, particularly among the residents of Hiran and Middle Shabelle regions, by dealing with its symptoms and root causes Its main objective for the coming five years (2003-2007) is to assist vulnerable people affected by man-made and naturaldisasters such as drought, civil war and floods. The organisation covers the entire country, but currently focuses its work in the Hiran and Middle Shabelle regions.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
